facts.1: World Population Day is observed to bring awareness to global population issues.
facts.2: It was established by the United Nations Development Programme in 1989.
facts.3: The event was inspired by the public interest in Five Billion Day on July 11, 1987, the approximate date on which the world's population reached five billion people.

facts.1: National 7-Eleven Day is celebrated on July 11th (7/11) in the United States to match the convenience store chain's name.
facts.2: 7-Eleven often offers a free Slurpee to each customer to mark the occasion.
facts.3: The company has been celebrating this day since 2002.

facts.1: Nadaam is the most widely watched festival in Mongolia, centered on three traditional sports: wrestling, horse racing, and archery.
facts.2: Nadaam literally means 'game' or 'competition' in Mongolian.
facts.3: The festival has its roots in the military parades of the Genghis Khan era.
